title: New: Nona Marie and the Choir – II
content:
It’s not often that an album completely takes me off guard, it’s very rarely because of un-listenable experimental reasons, more because of the conservative nature of the music.

The new record from Nona Marie and the Choir is one of those records.

‘II’ is the follow up to the all girl choir’s self-titled debut. In many ways it does what it says on the tin. One piano and some of the most graceful voices i’ve heard in a long time. The harmonies are reserved yet delicate, the piano melodies are simple yet heartfelt and in essence it just want to pull at your heart strings,  which my god it achieves.

“I’ll come running if you love me today” the girls plead on ‘Save Me A Place‘. It’s music that’s surrounded by devotion, yet has enough backbone to not only believe in, but also to inspire. It promotes the idea that true human devotion to another is both empowering and natural.
